Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.server

Class VirtualView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.server.VirtualView
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewInterface
public class VirtualView
extends java.lang.Object
implements ViewInterface
This class simulates the presence of a view on the server (it takes care of receiving the translations of the requests, addressing them to the controller, receiving responses from the latter and sending them back to the real view located on the client.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

      public void sendMsg​(java.net.Socket socket, org.w3c.dom.Document msg)
      This method allows to send a XML message to client identified by socket.
      Parameters:
      socket - is the socket of the client that should receive the message
      msg - is the XML message to send

    • loginRequest

      public void loginRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.net.Socket socket)
      This method handles a login request, turns it over to the controller and, based on the server response, directs the response. It also assigns a random color to the player.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who want to log in username
      socket - is the socket associated with the new player

    • startGameRequest

      public void startGameRequest​(java.lang.String username)
      This method handles a startGame request, turns it over to the controller and directs the response.
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the player who's starting the game

    • createGodsRequest

      public void createGodsRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> ids)
      This method handles a createGods request, turns it over to the controller and, based on the server response, directs the response.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      ids - is the list of the gods chosen by the player

      public void choseGodRequest​(java.lang.String username, int godId)
      This method handles a choseGods request, turns it over to the controller and, based on the server response, directs the response.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      godId - is the id of the god chosen by the player

      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      playerChosen - is the player chosen to start the game

    • setupOnBoardRequest

      public void setupOnBoardRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String workerGender, int x, int y)
      This method handles a setupOnBoard request, turns it over to the controller and, based on the server response, directs the response.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      workerGender - is the gender of the worker that user request to place on board
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed his worker
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed his worker

    • moveRequest

      public void moveRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String workerGender, int x, int y)
      This method handles a move request, turns it over to the controller and, based on the server response, directs the response.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      workerGender - is the gender of the worker that user request to move
      x - is the x coordinate where user wants to move
      y - is the y coordinate where user wants to move

    • buildRequest

      public void buildRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String workerGender, int x, int y, int level)
      This method handles a move request, turns it over to the controller and, based on the server response, directs the response.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      workerGender - is the gender of the worker that user request to build
      x - is the x coordinate where user wants to build
      y - is the y coordinate where user wants to build
      level - is the level that the worker want to build

    • endOfTurn

      public void endOfTurn​(java.lang.String username)
      This method handles an endOfTurn request, turns it over to the controller and, based on the server response, directs the response.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request

    • endRequest

      public void endRequest​(java.lang.String username)
      This method handles an end request and remove the username from the clients list
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request

    • onLoginAcceptedRequest

      public void onLoginAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, Color color, java.net.Socket socket)
      This method handles the case where the login request from the new player has been accepted. It removes the client from the wait list, sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match. It warns unconnected clients that the lobby is no longer available when the lobby is filled.
      Parameters:
      username - is the new player's username
      color - is the new player's color
      socket - is the new player's socket

    • onLoginRejectedRequest

      public void onLoginRejectedRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.util.List<Error> errors, java.net.Socket socket)
      This method handles the case where the login request from the player has been rejected. It sends a message where it alerts the client that the request has been rejected.
      Parameters:
      username - is the is the username chosen by the player
      errors - is the error list where the errors that led to the rejection are contained
      socket - is the payer's socket

    • onStartGameAcceptedRequest

      public void onStartGameAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username)
      This method handles the case where the startGame request from the player has been accepted. It informs the client that the request has been accepted and updates the other clients that the match has started. It warns the challenger that he has to choose the gods.
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the player who started the game

    • onRejectedRequest

      public void onRejectedRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.util.List<Error> errors, java.lang.String mode)
      This method handles the case where the request from the player has been rejected. It sends a message where it alerts the client that the request has been rejected.
      Specified by:
      onRejectedRequest in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      username - is the is the username of the player who made the request
      errors - is the error list where the errors that led to the rejection are contained
      mode - is the message mode

    • onSetWorkerOnBoardRejectedRequest

      public void onSetWorkerOnBoardRejectedRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.util.List<Error> errors, java.lang.String mode, java.lang.String gender)
      This method handles the case where the setWorkerOnBoard request from the player has been rejected. It sends a message where it alerts the client that the request has been rejected.
      Parameters:
      username - is the is the username of the player who made the request
      errors - is the error list where the errors that led to the rejection are contained
      mode - is the mode of the request
      gender - is the gender of the worker for whom the request was made

    • onCreateGodsAcceptedRequest

      public void onCreateGodsAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> ids)
      This method handles the case where the createGods request from the player has been accepted. It sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match. It warns the next player that he has to choose his god.
      Parameters:
      username - is the is the username of the player who made the request
      ids - is the list of the gods chosen by the player

    • onChoseGodAcceptedRequest

      public void onChoseGodAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, int godId)
      This method handles the case where the choseGod request from the player has been accepted. It sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match. It warns the next player that he has to choose his god or, if this is the last player in turn, it warns the player who has to chose the starting player.
      Parameters:
      username - is the is the username of the player who made the request
      godId - is the id of the god that the player has chosen

    • onChoseStartingPlayerAcceptedRequest

      public void onChoseStartingPlayerAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String playerChosen)
      This method handles the case where the choseStartingPlayer request from the player has been accepted. It sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match. It warns the next player that he has to start to place his workers on the board.
      Parameters:
      username - is the is the username of the player who made the request
      playerChosen - is the username of the player chosen to start the game

    • onSetupOnBoardAcceptedRequest

      public void onSetupOnBoardAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String workerGender, int x, int y)
      This method handles the case where the setupOnBoard request from the player has been accepted. It sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match. It warns the next player that he has to place his workers on the board or, if this player has to place the other worker on board, it warns this player that he has to place his female worker on the board.
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      workerGender - is the gender of the worker that user request to place on board
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed his worker
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed his worker

    • onMoveAcceptedRequest

      public void onMoveAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, org.w3c.dom.Document answerMsg, org.w3c.dom.Document updateMsg)
      This method handles the case where the move request from the player has been accepted. It sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match.
      Specified by:
      onMoveAcceptedRequest in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      answerMsg - is the document to send to the player who made de request
      updateMsg - is the document to send to the other players

    • onBuildAcceptedRequest

      public void onBuildAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, org.w3c.dom.Document answerMsg, org.w3c.dom.Document updateMsg)
      This method handles the case where the build request from the player has been accepted. It sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match.
      Specified by:
      onBuildAcceptedRequest in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      answerMsg - is the document to send to the player who made the request
      updateMsg - is the document to send to the other players

    • onEndOfTurnAcceptedRequest

      public void onEndOfTurnAcceptedRequest​(java.lang.String username, org.w3c.dom.Document answerMsg, org.w3c.dom.Document updateMsg)
      This method handles the case where the endOfTurn request from the player has been accepted. It sends a positive response message to the client, and updates it to other clients in the match. It warns the next player that he has to start his turn.
      Specified by:
      onEndOfTurnAcceptedRequest in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      username - is the player who made the request
      answerMsg - is the document to send to the player who made the request
      updateMsg - is the document to send to the other players

      This method sends a warning message to the client that needs to log in
      Parameters:
      socket - is the client's socket

    • toDoStartMatch

      public void toDoStartMatch()
      This method sends a warning message to the client that needs to start the match and a wait message to the other clients.

    • toDoCreateGods

      public void toDoCreateGods()
      This method sends a warning message to the client that needs to create gods and a wait message to the other clients.

    • toDoChoseGod

      Specified by:
      toDoChoseGod in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the player who has to chose his god
      ids - is the list of remaining gods you can choose

    • toDoChoseStartingPlayer

      This method sends a warning message to the client that needs to chose the starting player and a wait message to the other clients.
      Specified by:
      toDoChoseStartingPlayer in interface ViewInterface

    • toDoSetupWorkerOnBoard

      public void toDoSetupWorkerOnBoard​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String gender)
      This method sends a warning message to the client that has to setup his gender worker on board and a wait message to the other clients.
      Specified by:
      toDoSetupWorkerOnBoard in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the player who has to place his gender worker on the board
      gender - is the gender of the worker to place on board

    • toDoTurn

      public void toDoTurn​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String firstOperation)
      This method sends a warning message to the client that has to play his turn and a wait message to the other clients.
      Specified by:
      toDoTurn in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      username - is the username of the player who has to play his turn
      firstOperation - is the first operation player can do in his turn

    • directlyWinCase

      public void directlyWinCase​(java.lang.String winnerUsername)
      This method handles the case where there is a directly winner in the game. It warns the winner player that he has won and the other players that they have lost. It warns all players that the match has finished.
      Specified by:
      directlyWinCase in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      winnerUsername - is the player who has won.

    • match2PlayerLose

      public void match2PlayerLose​(java.lang.String winnerUsername)
      This method handles the case where there is a loser in a 2 players match. It warns the winner player that he has won and loser that he lost. It warns all players that the match has finished.
      Specified by:
      match2PlayerLose in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      winnerUsername - is the player who has won.

    • match3PlayerLose

      public void match3PlayerLose​(java.lang.String loserUsername)
      This method handles the case where there is loser in a 3 players match. It warns the loser player that he lost.
      Specified by:
      match3PlayerLose in interface ViewInterface
      Parameters:
      loserUsername - is the player who has lost.

    • clientDown

      public void clientDown​(java.net.Socket disconnectedClient)
      This method works when a client is disconnected. It alerts other clients to the incident with a sign-out message and calls the method that will delete the lobby (game over).
      Parameters:
      disconnectedClient - is the disconnected client's socket

    • matchFinished

      public void matchFinished()
      This method works when the match has finished. It closes all sockets and removes the lobby from the list on the server.

    • lobbyNoLongerAvailable

      public void lobbyNoLongerAvailable()
      This method works when the lobby is full or the game has started. It alerts clients in the wait list that the lobby is no longer available.
